pr_title: Remove default value handling from DefaultNotificationAccessor

timeline.message: refactor(notifications): DefaultNotificationAccessor::getPageRequestForNotifications no longer accepts Nullable page number or page size.
feat(notifications): Default page size is now 100 instead of Integer.MaxValue.
refactor: Moved page and size checking below permissions check.

timeline.bodyText: I think the class that AuditEntryPageModel extends might have constants that could be used for the default values.
timeline.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: If those constants don't exist we should at least make some in this class
replies.author: bamandel

replies.bodyText: I am now using the constants in AlertPagedModel. But that introduces a new issue #1249 (comment)
replies.author: JakeMathews

timeline.message: feat(paging): Changed default page size to use the constants in AlertPagedModel.

timeline.bodyText: Spring requires a String constant in ReadPageController. We want to use the same defaults, but as an Integer. Should we convert the String to an Integer at runtime? Do what I've done here? Something else?
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.author: gkillough

replies.bodyText: Then it is no longer a constant.
replies.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: Alright, in that case maybe move the string constants into that interface and leave them as literals. Leave the integers in the paged model.
replies.author: gkillough
jamesrichard91

replies.bodyText: I was hesitant to do the String parsing at runtime, but I think that's better than declaring the constants twice.
replies.author: JakeMathews

timeline.message: refactor(paging): Based Integer constant off of String.
